page.title: 01WESTERN DEVIZES AND POULSHOT
page.content: Devizes is a small market town set in the heart of the Wiltshire country- side. It is of great historical importance having been founded immediately after the Norman Conquest when Bishop Roger established a Motte in 1080. The town developed around the castle, but the coming of the industrial age led to the building of the Kennet and Avon Canal and later a branch line of the Great Western Railway. These factors encouraged linear development towards the west. Within the last twenty-five years there has been much residential building - both council and private - in this area. Mayenne Place, the council estate, lies to the north of the major west-bound road. Its name commemorates the twinning of Devizes and Mayenne, France in 196 . Continuing westwards, the road
